job.title: Compliance Analyst
job.description:
Coinsquare is excited to announce an opening for a Compliance Analyst role! This person will support the efforts of maintaining core components of the Compliance program function. As a Compliance Analyst, this person will also help build a data focused approach to Compliance. 

Responsibilities :

  • Liaises with internal departments to obtain statistical data to maintain and update Compliance reports and databases on a regular basis 
  • Assists Compliance with administrative functions related to regulatory and corporate compliance program requirements and other ad hoc assigned duties where needed
  • Participates in Compliance department investigations and transactions monitoring
  • Participates in self-assessment, audit, quality assurance, and regulatory testing exercises
  • Completes ad hoc projects or miscellaneous duties as required
  • Develops awareness and knowledge of regulatory compliance requirements, developments and industry “best practices” through review of publications, participation in industry associations, employee development initiatives, etc.

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent preferred
  • 3-5 years of relevant experience in financial services
  • Business intelligence and project management skills
  • Experience performing data collection, research, analysis and administration
  • Introductory knowledge of Canadian securities laws and regulations
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracyStrong verbal/written communication and organizational skills
  • Strong research, problem-solving, and analytical skills
  • High level of enthusiasm and desire to learn and progress in skills
  • Solid time management skillsSolid interpersonal and team interaction skills
  • Previous compliance experience an asset

We’ve been featured in major media outlets across Canada and are always dedicated to bringing digital asset investing to the mainstream through our various operations like digital currency mining, funds, capital markets, and other offerings coming down the pipeline as we grow.

    Coinsquare for Android | iOS | Web

    Coinsquare is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment where we welcome and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. Should you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

job.title: Business Executive Director
job.description:
Securitize is the global fintech that’s creating real-time access for investors to invest and trade in the private markets, and in turn, for companies to raise the capital they need to grow. Recognized as a top 50 blockchain company, we are the industry-leading and the first end-to-end digital securities issuance and compliance platform operating on the blockchain.

 

We just received $48m in Series B from Wall Street & venture capital funding from top investors to aggressively expand our teams across New York, Miami, San Francisco, and remote offices. We are a global team comprised of top blockchain and financial industry talent-based globally, based in Tel Aviv, Buenos Aires, Tokyo, New York, and San Francisco. We’re backed by leading financial institutions and blockchain investors, including Blockchain Capital, Morgan Stanley, Banco Santander, and Coinbase.

 

Location: This is a remote opportunity.

 

Securitize ‘s CEO is seeking a trust advisor and a strategic Executive Business Director to coordinate and manage the essential activities of our business, making strategic plans to ensure all business functions are efficient and at their most productive. The ideal candidate will serve as a trusted advisor to the CEO and help to set the Securitize strategic direction. The successful candidate will serve as the strategic partner to address opportunities for growth while maintaining discipline in cost management, financial management, and capital structure. 

----Key opportunities may include targeted mergers, acquisitions, capital expansions, restructuring, strategic alliances and partnerships, joint ventures, operational investments, and possible portfolio divestitures. You must be a creative and results-driven thinker, an excellent problem solver and possess incredible interpersonal skills to effectively manage staff and act as the central contact for all business communications.

 

Responsibilities:

  •  Spearhead special projects: lead a metrics overhaul, conduct market research on an adjacent business opportunity, run an acquisition process (end-to-end).
  •  Lead the development of the strategic plan/framework for the organization while adhering to direction set by the CEO and Board of Directors. This includes formalizing and leading the strategic planning process, focusing on long term trends and outlook, and competitive intelligence.
  •  Co-lead the process of developing the building blocks of the strategic plan including working with finance to ensure the financial impact of each component is projected.
  •  Identify, engage, establish, and manage productive working partnerships to support Securitize products and technology platform, while developing and strengthening the ecosystem.
  •  Drive identification and integration activities, processes, and change management requirements.
  •  Maintaining strong understanding of client business and strategy, economic models, financial results, industry trends, and operational developments.
  •  Support the fundraising process and own financial and operations support.
  •  Prepare Board Meetings and Boards Packs, manage investor updates and support in Investor pitch decks.
  •  Have experience with M&A and various financing instruments.
  •  Drive executive-level operations – strategic and OKR planning, and business reviews.
  •  Support in strategic tasks and projects of the founders and the CEO, e.g., go-to-market strategies, partnerships, including high-level aspects of tasks intersecting with vertical units, such as core hiring, business intelligence, growth marketing, product strategy.

 

Additionally, you will:

  • Coordinate strategic business initiatives and guide to completion.
  • Manage logistics with the Board of Directors, including meeting dates and agendas, reports, and other meeting preparation, communicating with the Board on all the above
  • Act as a main consultant to the CEO.
  • Work with and/or lead cross-functional teams.
  • Assist CEO with internal communication, and ensure any problems are resolved.
  • Keep CEO abreast on current company climate (employee wellbeing, project statuses, new proposals, etc.)

 

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 6 years experience in a consultant management role
  • Fintech experience is highly preferred
  • Required Knowledge: Must have extensive knowledge of the crypto/blockchain ecosystem.
  •  Seasoned professional, with a strong strategy orientation, who has previously held several business and operational roles in fast paced and complex environments, especially in start-up / entrepreneurial environment.
  •  Experience with operational, accounting, tax, legal, regulatory on M&A.
  •  Ability to present in front of management teams and board of directors with confidence and persuasion.
  •  Strong knowledge of finance, investment, and equity markets as well as knowledge of SEC disclosure regulations.
  •  Ability to successfully manage multiple projects from conception to completion in a fast-paced team environment.
  •  Strategic thinker capable of providing clear, balanced advice/counsel on a broad range of strategic and complex management, product and go to market issues.
  •  Superb communication, facilitation, negotiation, and listening skills, accompanied by the ability to know how and when to influence, persuade, direct, challenge, and relinquish control.


The idea candidate will exhibit the following Chief of Staff attributes:

  • Super Organizer — An ideal candidate needs to be a methodical organizer. 
  • Strategic Thinker — The individuals must see the big picture of things. A strategic mindset helps align detailed work to the big picture strategy, as well as evaluate what is urgent versus important.
  • "Get things done" mentality- The CEO needs to know that responsibilities or tasks are guaranteed to get done. 
  • Trusted Operator — A trusted advisor across the entire leadership team- often exposed to sensitive or confidential information in the normal course of executing the role. Consequently, the person in that role has to innately appreciate how to manage such information in confidence.



Join an awesome company entering a hyper-growth phase

  • Unlimited Paid Time Off
  • Bonus program 
  • Remote work environment
  • Company paid professional development 
  • 100% Medical/dental/vision insurance
  • 401K

job.title: Technical Service Operations Lead
job.description:
ABOUT THE TEAM
Our Customer Service team is the public face of the company and provides first-class front-line support to our millions of customers. We are also internal customer-champions, working with product teams to ensure users stay at the forefront of everything Revolut does. We're a truly diverse, international group and we work across three European offices.

We hire people who know how to act fast, look for root causes and solve problems – not follow scripts. We expect every person to drive change and bring value to Revolut by contributing more than just resolving tickets. We dedicate a lot of time for personal and professional growth and as a result, by the time our agents "graduate" support they are fully trained to rock in any other role in the company (and are in demand from lots of teams!).

ABOUT THE ROLE
We’re looking for a skilled Technical Service Operations Lead to manage operations teams (up to 100 employees) and collaborate with product teams. A person in this role is responsible for Technical Operations Stream (bugs / outages / technical issues filtering) and working closely (functional management) with Engineering Team and CTO. 

This role is about developing a firm foundation for our operations and continuing to innovate on ways to scale it quickly and effortlessly. We want you to focus particularly on our customer satisfaction and process compliance in this role by finding a balance between consistency and positive experiences for all our customers.

In addition, this role will be assisting in building out the function globally. You’ll need to combine a sharp eye and discipline for delivery with a creative and process driven mindset to seek out and solve some of our most complex global challenges.

Location: Porto or 100% remote from any other location in Portugal

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
  • Responsible for the day-to-day management of Team Leaders group with responsibility for separate products (up to 30 employees)
  • Daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly operations KPI review and management
  • Develop a process for improving user CSAT without sacrificing quality parameters
  • Help build and implement processes and standards for delivery through the global network
  • Demonstrate excellent business analytics to perform root cause analysis activities
  • Align strategic program objectives
  • Responsibility for managing the performance of Team Leaders, coach and mentor them to reach their potential, always leading by example
  • Data Analysis of trending issues and continuous improvement of processes
  • Ensure correct implementation of staff training, quality assurance, development and performance programs in conjunction with Training Leads and Operational Manager
  • Drive continuous Support Improvement and Improve Problem Resolution times
  • Work with Product Owners to resolve any backend app errors
  • Incident Management as well as escalations to vendors

    • WHAT YOU WILL NEED
  • Experience in managing up to 30-50 employees
  • People management experience with strong coaching and mentoring skills
  • Excellent technical and analytical aptitude
  • SQL skills
  • Good understanding of crisis management framework
  • Demonstrated ability and commitment to go “Above and Beyond” the daily expectations of role duties when required

    • Other skills:
  • Track record of resolving mobile application errors would be beneficial
  • Knowledge, understanding of frontend/backend would be beneficial
  • Ability to handle multiple priorities and meet deadlines in stressful situations
  • Queue, spike and Backlog management experience


    • Some international travel might be required
    A little about us…When Revolut was founded in 2015, we had a vision to build a sustainable, digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health, empower them to have more control, and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2021 with 15 million Personal customers and over half a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services.


    What we’re looking for…Revolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our five core values: we believe that we Get it Done because we Think Deeper and are strongly rooted in the Dream Team. We Never Settle hence why we always Deliver Wow. You want to join a community of forward-thinking people - we are here for you. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work, giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means you’re not just another cog in the machine.

    THE BENEFITS
    • Competitive salary
    • Excellent training and guidance from our team
    • Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
    • Private medical care
    • Daily meal allowance

    By applying for the above role, you confirm that you have reviewed our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates.
